alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Prince George; Surry; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued November 11 at 2:31PM EST until November 11 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southern Charles City County in east central Virginia... Prince George County in south central Virginia... Northeastern Sussex County in southeastern Virginia... Northwestern Surry County in southeastern Virginia... * Until 300 PM EST. * At 231 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Disputanta, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Disputanta around 240 PM EST. Cabin Point around 250 PM EST. Garysville and Burrowsville around 255 PM EST. Charles City and Jordans Point around 300 PM EST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Taylors Corner, Newville, Wayside, Prince George Golf, Brandon, Barnetts, Gwaltney Corner, Oak Hill Corner, New Hope and Savedge. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Prince George; Surry; Sussex
